note: Depending on the country and year, it relates to income (measured after taxes and benefits) or to consumption, [per capita](#dod:per-capita). Following an update, World Bank PIP now uses 2021 [international-$](#dod:int_dollar_abbreviation) for its poverty and inequality data [available here](https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/share-living-with-less-than-550-int--per-day).
title: Share of population living on less than the upper-middle income poverty line: 2011 vs. 2017 prices
subtitle: The lower-middle income poverty line is $5.50 per day in 2011 prices and $6.85 per day in 2017 prices. This data is adjusted for inflation and differences in living costs between countries.
